description:
In accordance with the requirements of the State Council’s “Notice on Printing and Distributing New Coronavirus Nucleic Acid Testing Technicians and Infection Prevention and Control Training Program” by the Medical Treatment Team of the State Council’s Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism for the COVID-19 Epidemic, the Guangdong Provincial Health Commission will launch the 2021 New Coronary Pneumonia Infection Control Expert Class (Part The 51st period) activities, the relevant matters are hereby notified as follows:
Training content:
The key points of standardized management of medical waste in medical institutions, including process formulation, personnel training, system implementation, supervision and management
Trainees: Relevant persons in charge of health administrative departments at all levels, leaders of hospitals in charge of various medical institutions at all levels, full-time staff of the hospital infection management department, persons in charge of fever clinics, infection control supervisors, medical personnel, as well as medical, nursing, logistics, etc. Relevant staff.
　　 Training time: March 18, 2021 (Thursday).
Methods:
(1) "Yuewei Talent" WeChat public account.
(2) Guangdong Province Telemedicine Platform.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
1. since March 15, who has been to nanchang city in jiangxi province, especially on March 15 K783 train - 16, had a close contact with the asymptomatic infection of passengers (8 upper berth car no. 1, on the way men of about 1 hour) in 9 diners, must be the first reported to the active (CunTun) to the community, and consciously implement the nucleic acid detection and the corresponding control measures, such as failure to report, the consequences resulting from the breach, the relevant liability shall be pursued in accordance with the law.
2. All townships, departments, enterprises and public institutions should continue to strengthen the requirements of grid management and control, and do a good job in the investigation, registration and control of personnel from Nanchang City of Jiangxi Province and those who come back to our county via Nanchang Railway Station since March 15. Hotels, hotels, rental rooms, home stay, Internet cafes, bath and other places to strictly implement the registration system, such as found special cases immediately report.
3. The general public is not required to go to Nanchang City of Jiangxi Province in the near future. If they must go, they must take good personal protection, report to their work unit and community (village or village) "immediately" after returning, and implement relevant requirements for epidemic prevention and control.

description:
The Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism of the State Council will hold a press conference at the Xizhimen Office of the National Health Commission at 15:00 on April 11, 2021, to introduce the prevention, control, and vaccination of the new crown epidemic, problems, and answer questions from reporters.
Some details:

At present, the annual new coronavirus vaccination work is being carried out in an orderly manner. Till April 10, a total of 164.471 million doses of new coronavirus vaccine have been transplanted in various places, and the total number of doses of transplantation is the second in the world.

Building the educational vaccination protection system around the whole country's schools and colleges.

Two important focusing groups of people and areas, first one is important ports and cities, The second is the key population, including cold chain practitioners, medical and health personnel, personnel of government agencies, enterprises and institutions, college students and faculty, service personnel of large-scale supermarkets, and relevant personnel of transportation, logistics, and welfare institutions that guarantee the operation of the society.

description: On January 21, Hubei announced that suspected cases, confirmed cases, close contacts, and suspected exposures of new coronavirus infection should be put into quarantine. The confirmed cases shall be treated in isolation, and those who meet the discharge standards according to the relevant diagnosis and treatment plan shall be allowed to be discharged and lifted from isolation. Conduct medical observation in hospital isolation for suspected cases, and carry out laboratory investigations as soon as possible; if the new coronavirus infection is excluded by laboratory diagnosis, their quarantine can be lifted. Close contacts and suspected exposed persons shall be subject to medical observation at home or in centralized isolation, and the observation period shall be 14 days after the last contact with a case without effective protection or after a suspected exposure. During the medical observation period, if there is no fever (underarm body temperature ≥37.3°C), cough, shortness of breath and other symptoms of acute respiratory infection, the medical observation can be terminated after 14 days.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On January 24 2020, Inner Mongolia reported its first confirmed case of COVID-19. The Inner Mongolia government started to activate the first-level public health emergency response at noon on January 25, 2020.

Inner Mongolia strengthened the prevention of the influx of people from affected areas and implemented control measures. These measures were including on-site quarantine, on-site observation, and on-site treatment of patients with infectious diseases and suspected patients; centralized or home-based medical observation of close contacts according to their situation.

Moreover, railway, transportation, civil aviation, inspection and quarantine departments set up temporary transportation sanitation and quarantine stations at transportation stations and entry and exit ports to conduct quarantine inspections on people who entered and left Inner Mongolia. Patients with infectious diseases and suspected patients were required to temporarily quarantine，examine and transfer to designated institutions of the local health department.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On March 2nd, 2020, based on the three-level response regulation, the government of Sichuan implements the new quarantine rules in high-risk areas. 

People from the high-risk areas:
(1) People travelling from the Coronavirus hotspots in Hubei should be subject to collective quarantine under medical observation for 14 days. (2) People travelling from the other the high-risk areas should be either subject to collective quarantine or under self-isolation at home for 14 days. (3) People travelling from the other overseas Coronavirus hotspots should be either subject to collective quarantine or be under self-isolation at home for 14 days. (4) Confirmed patients and people who display the Coronavirus symptoms can be only released after receiving treatments from proper medical institutions. (5) People who do not display the Coronavirus symptoms should be under medical observation for 14 days and have negative results of nucleic tests twice consecutively (intervals of tests should be at least one day).
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On March 17, the Hainan Provincial Headquarters for the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Epidemic issued the "Notice on Orderly Repatriation of People Stranded in Hubei in Our Province". According to the relevant regulations of Hubei Province, the following notices are made on the matters related to the return of Hainan residents stranded in Hubei (excluding Wuhan):

1. Those who have a history of residence in Hubei (excluding Wuhan) within 14 days can apply for returning to Hainan to their unit, enterprise or village (residential) committee in Hainan by telephone, email, fax, etc. in advance.

 2. The personnel returning to Hainan in Hubei shall apply to the county-level pass certificate or health monitoring certificate, he must use "point-to-point, one-stop" chartered flights, chartered vehicles or self-driving methods to return to Hainan in a precise, safe and orderly manner.

3. After arriving at the destination, people returning from Hubei to Qiong should immediately report to their unit, enterprise or village (residential) committee for registration, and strictly implement 14-day self-home isolation measures.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
To earnestly respond to the secondary response requirements for public health emergencies in Henan Province and improve the economic and social operation methods compatible with epidemic prevention and control, the Municipal Epidemic Prevention Work Leading Group decided to strengthen the prevention and control of the epidemic. Further, take the following measures:

1. Prevent imported overseas epidemics more precisely

Earnestly implement the central government’s “perfect data sharing, information notification, and entry-exit personnel verification mechanism,” establish special prevention and control work teams for the three hubs of airports, high-speed railways, and railway stations, strictly implement “dual-code scanning,” and measure body temperature. Relocation, transshipment, isolation, and other measures have further strengthened the control of people entering Zhengzhou from abroad.

2. Centralized quarantine of people entering Zheng from abroad

From March 20, 2020, the Zhengzhou New Crown Pneumonia Epidemic Prevention and Control Leading Group will implement centralized isolation and implement medical observation recommendations for residents from abroad in Zhengzhou at their own expense. Older people over 70 years old, minors, pregnant women, and immigrants with special circumstances (such as serious basic diseases) can apply for family quarantine. After strict evaluation by the county (city, district), the village (resident) will implement 14 isolation measures at

description: On April 20, 2020, China, Guangxi Provincial Health Department requires all arrivals to be quarantined for 28 days. Afterall arrivals, people will be required to stay in the designated inspection point and be quarantined for 14 days for medical inspection. After 14 days of medical inspection, arriving personal will be asked to follow the stay home order for another 14 days. Meanwhile, two COVID testings and one antibody testing are required. Arrivals from high infected areas, which include but not limited to Heilongjiang Province, Neimenggu Province, Liaoning Province, Guangdong Province, and Beijing Province, will need to present a negative COVID test result within a week and healthy self-reporting report history or will be denied to enter.

description:
From 24 April 2020, Inner Mongolia is implementing a two-week quarantine on visitors from the domestic locations classified as “middle-risk and high-risk zones”, including Daowai district, Nangang district, Daoli district, Hulan district, Acheng district, Mulan county; Suifenhe city and Xi’an District in Heilongjiang province; Shuncheng district in Liaoning province;  Baiyun district and Yuexiu district in Guangdong province; Beijing’s Chaoyang District (adjusted according to the situation dynamically ). They enter Inner Mongolia will be subject to “14-day centralised medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test”.

From 12 am on 10 May 2020, Inner Mongolia cancels the two-week quarantine on visitors from the domestic locations where already adjusted from “medium-risk and high-risk zones” to “low-risk zones”, including Daowai district, Nangang district, Daoli district, Hulan district, Acheng district, Mulan county; Suifenhe city and Xi’an District in Heilongjiang province; Shuncheng district in Liaoning province. They enter Inner Mongolia will not be subject to “14-day centralised medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test”.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative units within one or more countries (e.g. county)

description: Jiangsu-bound travelers who have entered China via airports in Shanghai will be transferred for quarantine and health observation starting from 00:00 on August 2. After their seven-day quarantine period is over, those tested negative will be transferred from quarantine sites in Shanghai to the Kunshan Transfer Base by dedicated staff and vehicles of Jiangsu Province in a seamless and hermetic manner and then start another seven days isolated health observation.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: China, Inner Mongolia, Tongliao City is enforcing a two-week quarantine on people who ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant" between 12:30 pm and 13:50 pm on August 25, 2020. Because on August 25, five close contacts of COVID-19 from other provinces had transferred trains in Tongliao City. During the period from 12:30 pm to 13:50 pm, they ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant". People who ate at the "Kulun Hele Restaurant" between 12:30 pm and 13:50 pm on August 25 should actively contact the local CDC, be quarantined for medical observation for 14 days and accept temperature check twice daily in the morning and evening.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Quarantine policies for international travelers to Shanghai with their final destination in neighboring Jiangsu, Zhejiang, or Anhui provinces who tests negative after three days of quarantine in Shanghai－instead of the current seven days－will be transferred to their city of destination to finish the last 11 days of quarantine in designated places, starting on 12th September 2020.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On October 25, 2020, Ordos, Inner Mongolia requires people who travelled from Kashgar, Xinjiang since October 10 have entered Ordos, who must provide a negative result of nucleic acid test certificate within 7 days or a health QR code includes the negative result of nucleic acid test information within 7 days. They can move freely and orderly under the premise of normal body temperature and effective personal protection. If people are unable to provide a negative result of nucleic acid test information or have not yet undergone the nucleic acid test, they must conduct centralised quarantine and nucleic acid testing immediately. Those people can flow in an orderly manner after the nucleic acid test result is negative.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
On October 26, 2020, Bayannur, Inner Mongolia requires people who travelled from Kashgar, Xinjiang since October 10 have entered Bayannur, who must provide a negative result of nucleic acid test certificate within 7 days or a health QR code includes the negative result of nucleic acid test information within 7 days. 

If people cannot provide those mentioned above negative nucleic acid test information, they will be immediate centralized quarantine and complete the nucleic acid test within 24 hours. If people receive the nucleic acid test result is positive, they will be immediately sent to designated medical institutions to receive treatment in isolation. 

All close contacts of confirmed cases and asymptomatic coronavirus carriers will be subject to the control measure of "14-day centralized medical observation, two times nucleic acid tests and one-time antibody test".
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
On 22 Nov 2020，Baotou Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced that since 25 October, people travelled from Hangu Street, Binhai New District, Tianjin; Zone A and B of Central Fishing Port Cold Chain Logistics Park, Tianjin; Yingqian Village, Zhuqiao Town, Pudong New District, Shanghai; Mingtian Huacheng Community, Zhoupu Town, Shanghai；Zhangyang Community, Shencheng Town, Yingshang County, Fuyang City, Anhui Province, etc., as well as since 7 November，people travelled from the North District Sub-district Office and Dongshan Sub-district Office, Manzhouli City, Hulunbuir; Xinsheng Community, Zhuqiao Town, Pudong New District, Shanghai, they are required to provide the negative nucleic acid test results (the certificate of negative results of nucleic acid tests issued within seven days or the health QR code of negative nucleic acid test results issued within 7 days) for entering Baotou city. 
If people could not show the negative nucleic acid test results or did not receive the nucleic acid tests, they would undergo centralized quarantine and nucleic acid tests immediately.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:

description: From Jan 28 to March 08, 2021, the Chongqing government requests the people who have been travelers from the high-risk area keep self-isolation. In principle, the people from the medium-risk area are also requested to keep self-isolation. However, those people could migrate if they can effectively provide the 3-day expiration COVID-19 test result.  Meanwhile, the people who come from low-risk areas and work for government isolation places, cold-chain importing and food transportation have to provide the 7-day expiration COVID-19 test result if they would like to migrate.

description:
On January 22, 2020, Hubei announced that all districts must strengthen the management of agricultural markets and various business premises, and strictly clean, disinfect and ventilate them.
Medium and above cities that are national sanitary cities or have set such districts are strictly forbidden to trade live poultry, implementing "designated slaughtering of poultry, harmless treatment, and listing of white striped poultry." Other regions should implement "one cleaning each day, one disinfection each week, one closure each month" system on agricultural markets.

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered construction units and general contractors to strictly control the entry and exit of personnel on the construction sites, establish a personnel entry and exit filing system and guarantee the basic living conditions of the guards and construction personnel. The units and contractors must keep track of the dynamic information of construction workers in time, do proper investigation and registration, and pay attention to the workers' health status. Once a suspected or confirmed COVID-19 case was found, they must timely report and properly deal with it to achieve early detection, early reporting, early quarantine, and early handling.

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered construction units and general contractors to follow the requirements of local epidemic prevention departments, implementing epidemic prevention and disinfection measures, promptly clearing the blind spots of the construction sites and dormitory areas, and doing proper garbage removal, sewage treatment, drainage of ditches and sewers, and elimination of the "four hazards". description:
On January 28, 2020, the Local Financial Supervision Administration of Hubei ordered financial institutions to urge their personnel to raise awareness of scientific prevention and control, to learn and master prevention knowledge and measures, and to rationally view the development, prevention, and control of the epidemic. 
The units must seriously conduct in-store disinfection and fully grasp the whereabouts of their personnel. They must establish a daily report and investigation system with specified implementation personnel and urge all personnel to report every day. If personnel or their family members had confirmed or suspected cases of the novel coronavirus infected pneumonia, the units must promptly report to local disease prevention and control agencies and urge the infected to see a doctor or take corresponding quarantine measures.

description:
On January 28, 2020, the Hubei Provincial Grain Bureau ordered all kinds of grain and oil enterprises in the province to increase consciously grain and oil production and supply, strengthen overall planning, and try to connect effectively grain and oil processing, storage, transportation, distribution, and supply to maintain a smooth operation of all links, ensuring that grain and oil supply would not be out of stock, and increasing the market’s ability to react in emergency and distribution capabilities. 

The enterprises should cooperate with government regulation, patiently and meticulously publicize and explain to consumers information based on facts, such as sufficient grain and oil stocks, ample market supply, and perfect grain reserve emergency system, and guide consumers to buy grain nearby and rationally, and avoid queuing up and panic buying.

The enterprises should also do proper and safe disinfection of on-the-job personnel and the work site, strictly require them to wear protective equipment to work, and strengthen temperature measurement and inspection. The enterprises should arrange properly the working and boarding of employees during holidays, and care about their health. They should improve the emergency plan for epidemic prevention and control and deal with problems found according to relevant requirements in time.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 31, 2020, Emergency Management Department of Hubei announced that all industrial, mining, and commercial enterprises in the province (except for those producing epidemic prevention and control materials) shall not resume work and production earlier than 24:00 on February 13, 2020. Districts should plan for resumption of work and production accordingly, and submit plans to the Safety Production Foundation Division of the Department before February 10, 2020.
All industrial, mining and commercial enterprises must establish an epidemic prevention and control leading group with the principal in charge. 
These enterprises should strengthen the security guards and protection of factory (mining) areas, and be equipped with infrared thermometers, masks, disinfectants, etc. as necessary. They must strictly observe people who had contact with key areas of the epidemic; isolate people who had symptoms such as fever and those they had contact with, and report promptly.
The enterprises must reinforce education and training of epidemic prevention and control policies and measures, and safety production and emergency management knowledge for main persons in charge, safety management personnel and special operation personnel through self-teaching, online videos, etc.
The enterprises must investigate hidden dangers of key parts and equipment.
Enterprises that did not fulfill rules above must not resume work. Those in severe violations would be in the safety production "blacklist."
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

Districts should plan for resumption of work and production accordingly, and submit plans to the Safety Production Foundation Division of the Department before February 10, 2020.
All industrial, mining and commercial enterprises must establish an epidemic prevention and control leading group with the principal in charge. 
These enterprises should strengthen the security guards and protection of factory (mining) areas, and be equipped with infrared thermometers, masks, disinfectants, etc. as necessary. They must strictly observe people who had contact with key areas of the epidemic; isolate people who had symptoms such as fever and those they had contact with, and report promptly.
The enterprises must reinforce education and training of epidemic prevention and control policies and measures, and safety production and emergency management knowledge for main persons in charge, safety management personnel and special operation personnel through self-teaching, online videos, etc.
The enterprises must investigate hidden dangers of key parts and equipment.
Enterprises that did not fulfill rules above must not resume work. Those in severe violations would be in the safety production "blacklist."
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 31, 2020, Alxa League Command Center for COVID-19 Control and Prevention, Inner Mongolia announced that enterprises must not resume work and must not require employees to return to work before 24 o'clock on February 9, 2020. Except for enterprises were involved in ensuring the operation of the city (water supply, gas supply, power supply, communications, etc.), epidemic prevention and control (medical equipment, medicines, protective equipment production and sales, etc.), people’s daily necessities (supermarkets, farmers’ markets, food production and logistics supply, etc. ) and other enterprises related to the important national economy and people's livelihood. Enterprises that had not stopped production and operations were not allowed to recall employees outside Alxa League in advance.

description:
Opinions of the General Office of Shandong Provincial People's Government on Supporting the Stable and Healthy Development of Small and Medium Enterprises in Response to the New Covid-19 pandemic.
In order to thoroughly implement the important instruction of General Secretary Xi Jinping on resolutely winning the battle against the epidemic, fully implement the decision and deployment of the Party Central Committee and the State Council on the prevention and control of the epidemic, support small and medium-sized enterprises to actively cope with the impact of the epidemic and achieve stable and healthy development, with the consent of the provincial Party committee and the provincial government, the following opinions are put forward:
1. Strengthen financial support.
2. Reduce the burden of taxes and fees.
3. Reduce operating costs.
4. Increase efforts to stabilize employment.
The above policy measures are applicable to the small and medium-sized enterprises identified by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology and other four departments issuing the "Regulations on the Standard for the Classification of Small and Medium-sized Enterprises" (Ministry of Industry and Information Technology Joint Enterprise [2011] No. 300), which shall be implemented from the date of issuance and shall be valid for a temporary period of three months.

General Office of the People's Government of Shandong Province
February 4, 2020
institution_status: This type of business ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with no conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
The General Office of Shandong Provincial People's Government issued a notice on actively responding to the COVID-19 epidemic and speeding up the recovery of agricultural production to ensure important agricultural products.

In order to effectively respond to the adverse impact of the new pneumonia epidemic, resume agricultural production in the province as soon as possible, press the "vegetable basket" mayor to take charge of the system and ensure the supply of important agricultural products in the market, the following measures are formulated. 

1. Accelerate the construction of agricultural enterprises and the stable resumption of agricultural production 


2. strengthen the effective docking of production and marketing, expand the sale of agricultural products 


3. orderly break the traffic obstruction, smooth the flow of people and logistics in urban and rural areas 

4. Coordinate the use of agricultural-related funds and increase financial and taxation support 

5. Create precise preferential policies and improve financial services 

6. Strengthen the organization and leadership, and consolidate local responsibilities

General Office of the People's Government of Shandong Province

11 February 2020
institution_status: This type of business ("Agriculture; forestry and fishing") is allowed to open with no conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Since 17th of February 2020, Hainan province announced that shopping mall should suspend services of maternity rooms, children's playgrounds, and indoor entertainment venues. For other places that cannot be closed, should be disinfected first and reopen. All of the staffs who working in the shopping mall should wear mask and check temperature everyday. The shopping mall should also set emergency area for isolation. The staffs should keep social distance when working together or using elevators and avoid gathering.

description:
Henan, China issued a series of policies regarding to reopening non-coal mining industry on Feb 17. For example,
Companies should follow the regulations of coronavirus prevention and control. They should prepare and submit a proposal for epidemic prevention and control.
Employees must come back to work in turn and implement health testing and self-quarantine.
Employees must wear masks when entering the workplace.
Workplace should be disinfected regularly.
Cases must be reported to local departments.

description:
China's Hunan Province unveiled plans to shut down their exotic food industry at the end of April 2020. The plan included a financial compensation of 120 Yuan to farmers per kilogram of snake and 75 Yuan per kilogram of bamboo rat. A fixed compensation was offered for other animals such as porcupine, civets, wild goose and more. 

Existing stocks were to be released to nature or used for purposes other than for food or to burn or burry them.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Supermarkets/grocery stores") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 22nd, 2021, Hebei, China published a guide for COVID-19 prevention and control at construction sites. The "Guide" requires that an epidemic prevention and control organization be established by the project leader at the construction site, equipped with adequate medical protective masks, protective clothing, goggles, disposable gloves, disinfectant alcohol, and disinfectant that meet national and industry standards. , Anti-epidemic materials such as intelligent body temperature detection equipment, and reliable supply channels. Real-name management is implemented for the entry personnel. The entry personnel must hold a health code and have a negative nucleic acid test before entering the construction site. After entering the construction site, the nucleic acid test should be performed in a timely manner according to the situation. All management personnel and migrant workers who enter the construction area, office area, and living area, including service personnel such as security guards, cleaning, canteens, etc., must wear masks, and the changed masks must be properly handled. Except for procurement personnel, material supply vehicles and personnel (the two categories of personnel should also check the health code and temperature measurement registration), all other personnel are not allowed to enter the site, and personnel at the entrance and exit shall be on duty 24 hours a day.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Construction") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 28, the Henan Provincial Culture and Tourism Department announced specific guidelines for the tourism market on epidemics prevention and control during the Spring Festival of 2021. 
In principle, no large-scale events should be held during the Spring Festival period. Otherwise, it must be strictly approved based on careful evaluation. The number of audiences in theatres and other performance venues shall not exceed 75% of the theatre's seating capacity. For venues containing multiple theatre rooms, measures shall be implemented so the audiences can enter and exit through different routes and times to avoid large-scale gatherings. For all types of entertainment venues, the number of customers allowed for entrance shall not exceed 75% of the regular allowance. 
For travel agencies, safety risk assessments on tourism routes must be carefully conducted. It is strictly forbidden to organize travel to medium- and high-risk areas. Local administrative departments should urge travel agencies to implement the "one group, one report" system -- filling in travel information and uploading the electronic contracts on the national tourism supervision service platform for inspection. 
Star-rated should implement the epidemic prevention and control measures such as regular nucleic acid testing on imported cold-chain food and workers, disinfecting public supplies and appliances and widening the distance between tables.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions_This type of business  ("${lm://Field/1}") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered the Housing and Construction Departments of all levels to strengthen the safety protection of environmental sanitation operators and front-line law enforcement team members. All front-line personnel must take safe and effective protective measures during the epidemic prevention and control period. All units must distribute masks, gloves, and other protective equipment in full to prevent infection of workers. The departments must organize training and guidance for sanitation and cleaning personnel, teach them correct protection methods, and prevent cross-infection due to lack of protection. The departments must reasonably arrange work and rest, scientifically control labor intensity, and prevent problems such as excessive fatigue.

Waste transportation should use fully enclosed vehicles to prevent odor diffusion, omission, leakage of leachate, and secondary pollution. The departments should disinfect waste collection sites, operation vehicles, tools, and other environmental sanitation facilities and equipment.

Once an emergency occurred, the departments must deal with it as soon as possible and report in time according to regulations. They must strengthen the reporting of information, establish a daily reporting system for personnel control and epidemic prevention and control of the unit, and accurately report relevant information.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Department of Hubei ordered the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Departments of all levels within the province to strengthen the protective measures for employees, and fully manage the movements and actions of personnel. The departments must effectively strengthen the responsibilities of emergency duty posts and strictly implement the 24-hour special-person on-duty and leadership-led shift system. The departments must strengthen information reporting and implement a “daily report” system for the outbreak of new coronavirus infection pneumonia.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to implement temporary closed management. They should cancel all kinds of collective activities, decline all kinds of volunteer services, parties, and condolences; people outside the hospital who must enter for work must not come into contact with children in the children’s living area. The institutions must carefully register, do temperature measurement, disinfection, etc. on entering and exiting personnel, and those with fever might not enter. The institutions must cancel children’s collective play activities and avoid them going to densely populated public places. For cases of pneumonia suspected of being infected by the new coronavirus, the institutions should put them under quarantine and send them to a doctor in time, and report and assist in investigation.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to maintain hygiene in children’s living environment and food. They should open windows of children’s living areas and activity rooms regularly every day for ventilation to maintain indoor air circulation, wipe and disinfect children’s bed rails, toys, tables and chairs regularly, and record the wiping and disinfection work. They should regularly carry out children's temperature monitoring, restrict children from drinking unboiled water or eating raw or cold food, avoid their sharing of water cups, tableware, towels, toothbrushes and other items, let them thoroughly clean hands with running water before and after meals, to develop good hygiene habits.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all child welfare institutions to strengthen the self-protection of staff. The staff must wear work clothes and masks, wash hands frequently, and develop good hygiene during work. They must wash and disinfect their hands before serving and feeding children. When the staff accompany children to the hospital, they must take various protective measures. During the work period, the institutions must check on all staff regularly. If they had fever, cough and other suspected symptoms, the institutions must put them under quarantine, send them to medical treatment in time, and report relevant information.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to do proper prevention and control of the epidemic situation for inbound and on-site personnel. All rescue and management agencies shall open up emergency quarantine observation areas for epidemic prevention and control, equipped with infrared forehead thermometers and sanitary and epidemic prevention materials. They should ask new arrivals about their physical condition and temperature; transfer those found to have fever, fatigue, cough and other symptoms immediately to an independent observation area for observation or to a hospital for examination.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to do proper sanitation management. They should reinforce sanitation and cleaning, change and wash clothes and quilts in time, open windows regularly for ventilation, conduct regular site disinfection, maintain environmental sanitation of the institution, and ensure the safety of medication and catering.

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered relief and management agencies for the homeless and beggars to reinforce the self-protection of the staff. They should carry out epidemic prevention and control education for staff, properly monitor the body temperature of personnel entering and leaving the agencies, and implement a daily health report system for personnel. They should strengthen the contact and linkage mechanism with the health and epidemic prevention departments to ensure responding and handling problems in a timely manner. Without special circumstances, during the Spring Festival, the agencies should not send and pick up people served at the agencies.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered funeral homes to strengthen the protective measures for funeral workers. They should equip funeral service personnel with masks, disinfectants, thermometers and other necessary protective equipment, and staff who came into contact with the remains of patients with new pneumonia (including suspected patients) should implement the most stringent protective measures. They should reinforce the epidemic prevention and control of key areas such as the business halls, service negotiation rooms, and ash collection areas, set up special reception desks, allow no more than 2 family members to handle the business at a time, and adopt methods such as wearing masks, measuring body temperature, washing and disinfecting hands, reinforcing the safety and protection of front-line workers. The funeral homes must strictly disinfect all workplaces and ventilate facilities to eliminate all hidden dangers that may spread the virus.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that funeral homes should cremate the remains of patients with COVID-19 (including suspected patients) who died in the burial reform areas. For those died in counties (cities, districts) without cremation facilities, the municipal (prefecture) Civil Affairs department should report to the local epidemic prevention headquarters, and designate funeral parlors to send special vehicles to pick the remains up and conduct cremation nearby. All funeral homes shall set up special passages, special funeral vehicles, special cremation machines and isolation areas. After completing the relevant procedures such as death certificates, handover of the remains, and approval of cremation, the funeral homes should transport the deceased’s remains directly to the cremation room for cremation. During the handover of the remains, the funeral homes must confirm that medical and health institutions had carried out sanitation and epidemic prevention treatment.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that funeral homes should advise families of the deceased not to hold farewell ceremonies. After receiving a telephone appointment, the funeral homes must properly transport the remains, and advise the families of the deceased to reduce the number of people attending funerals and not to hold farewell ceremonies. If the family members still insisted on holding farewell ceremonies, the funeral homes must strictly control the scale of attendance and take corresponding prevention and control measures.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei announced that for non-relatives and -friends of the deceased, all cemeteries, ashes halls and other ashes storage facilities in the province would be closed. Except for the needs of ashes placement, the ashes storage facilities should prohibit other personnel from entering and exiting, and suspend all sacrifice and sweeping activities.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered the Provincial Welfare Lottery Center, the City and State Management Station, and the Zhongfu Sales Agencies with Online Agreements to postpone the opening of the welfare lottery market. After the resumption of the market, they must implement the epidemic prevention and control requirements for business sites strictly. They must open windows regularly for ventilation, regular cleaning, and disinfection of welfare lottery sales agencies and various operations, maintaining environmental sanitation. Before the epidemic ended, staff and sales personnel should wear masks and other protective equipment to work. Lottery ticket buyers entering sales agencies or operations should wear masks as requested.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to sort out the situations of their staff going out during the holiday carefully. If the staff had a history of contact with people diagnosed with COVID-19, they should consciously go into quarantine and observe; if they had suspected symptoms such as fever and cough, they should seek medical treatment in time and report to the local disease control department.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to establish a temperature monitoring system for employees and staff after the holiday. The departments should strictly manage the entry and exit of outsiders, and all visitors shall register and measure their body temperature. For public spaces such as canteens, meeting rooms, and offices, the departments should carry out disinfection and opening windows for ventilation regularly. The departments should also simplify meetings, reduce personnel gathering, and arrange and carry out work through video and telephone conferences and work chat groups as much as possible.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered civil affairs departments of all levels within the province to apply to establish a fast and convenient medical channel for personnel of civil service agencies. The departments should implement the "two teams on duty simultaneously" and "report even with zero cases" systems. All localities and units must develop an emergency response plan for the epidemic, strictly conduct regular duty on holiday and duty for emergency epidemic prevention, and strictly implement the mechanism of leadership on duty, 24-hour duty on important positions, and the information reporting system.

description: On January 29, 2020, the Higher People's Court of Hubei announced that during the epidemic prevention and control period, litigation service centers of courts at all levels in the province would be closed and not take in case applications. For people intending to file a case in court, the Court recommended them to do so online through channels such as Hubei Court Litigation Service (http://www.hbfy.org/electronic court section), Hubei Mobile WeChat Court (adding the WeChat Miniprogram via mobile phone). For those finding online filing inconvenient, the Court recommended them to mail their application materials to the relevant court.

description: On January 30, 2020, the Financial Department of Hubei announced that, in principle, the gathering of personnel for on-site bid opening and bid evaluation of government procurement projects should be suspended or postponed. For government procurement projects affected by this, the purchaser or procurement agency shall issue a correction announcement in accordance with the laws, and notify the relevant suppliers and review experts through in-person calls, text messages or emails. If it was really necessary to carry out government procurement bid opening, bid evaluation and other activities due to work needs, under the principle of “responsibility following purchases,” the purchaser should perfect personnel registration and protection, site disinfection and ventilation and other protective measures to ensure that the health and safety of reviewers and relevant staff. When the emergency response to the epidemic in the province got terminated, normal procurement activities should resume without further notice.

description: On January 30, 2020, Hubei's Department of Justice announced that during the epidemic prevention and control period, administrative reconsideration reception sites would be temporarily closed and stopped accepting applicants. The resumption time of reception would be determined by local departments depending on the changes in the epidemic. Applicants were encouraged to apply for administrative reconsideration by mail, and localities and departments where conditions permitted should accept administrative reconsideration application materials online. If the applicant really needed to submit an application for administrative reconsideration in person, they must comply with relevant regulations on epidemic prevention and control. In principle, administrative reconsideration would mainly be through written hearings, and no file reviews or hearing matters would be arranged for the time being.

The resumption time would be announced separately. During this period, if one needed to make a complaint or report to the Hubei Provincial Public Resources Transaction Supervision and Administration Bureau, it was recommended to mail the complaint and report materials to the Bureau.

description: Most provinces have set start dates for schools as the epidemic ebbs with nearly zero domestic cases reported since March. The specific return time and related requirements will be notified to each student by the school. Students who have not received the notification will not return to school temporarily. description:
Notice of the Market Management Department of the Ministry of Culture and Tourism on Further Strengthening the Normalization of Epidemic Prevention and Control in Theaters and Other Performance Places, Internet Service Places, and Entertainment Places:

(1) In low-risk areas of the epidemic, there will no longer be uniform restrictions on the proportion of consumers receiving theaters and other performance venues, Internet service venues, and entertainment venues. The party committees and governments of each province (region, city) will control themselves according to the local epidemic prevention and control situation.

(2) To hold large-scale commercial performances, it is necessary to strengthen communication and coordination with public security and other departments, and appropriately control the number of people in accordance with local epidemic prevention and control requirements.

(3) Suspend the new approval of foreign-related, Hong Kong, Macao, and Taiwan-related commercial performance activities (except for those with cast members already in China)

(4) If a local epidemic occurs in the area, it is recommended to strictly control or suspend performances according to the specific situation.

For more details please check the

description:
Notice of Department of Market Management, Ministry of Culture and Tourism on 12th March: 
All public places(just low-risk areas) have actively promoted the orderly restoration of theaters and other performance venues, Internet service venues, and entertainment venues and without any restriction of people capacity. However, there are a few tips and restrictions for this policy.
(1) In low-risk areas of the epidemic, there will no longer be uniform restrictions on the proportion of consumers receiving theaters and other performance venues, Internet service venues, and entertainment venues. The party committees and governments of each province (region, city) will control themselves according to the local epidemic prevention and control situation.
(2) Holding large-scale commercial performances, it is necessary to strengthen communication and coordination with public security and other departments, and appropriately control the number of people in accordance with local epidemic prevention and control requirements.
(3) Suspend the new approval of foreign-related, Hong Kong, Macao, and Taiwan-related commercial performance activities (except for those with cast members already in China).
(4) If a local epidemic occurs in an area, it is recommended to strictly control or suspend performances according to the specific situation.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On January 26, 2020, the Housing and Urban-Rural Development Department of Hubei Province ordered the Housing and Construction Departments of all levels to strengthen the safety protection of environmental sanitation operators and front-line law enforcement team members. All front-line personnel must take safe and effective protective measures during the epidemic prevention and control period. All units must distribute masks, gloves, and other protective equipment in full to prevent infection of workers. The departments must organize training and guidance for sanitation and cleaning personnel, teach them correct protection methods, and prevent cross-infection due to lack of protection. The departments must reasonably arrange work and rest, scientifically control labor intensity, and prevent problems such as excessive fatigue.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Regulations on publicly provided waste management services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all elderly care institutions to comply with the Ministry of Civil Affairs’ “Guidelines for the Prevention and Control of the Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Outbreak of Elderly Care Institutions,’’ formulate an emergency response plan for the epidemic, strengthen the primary responsibility of the institution directors, strengthen personnel investigation, and monitor their epidemic cases. The institutions should put cases of pneumonia suspected of being infected by the new coronavirus into quarantine and send them to a doctor in time, while reporting and assisting in investigations. Institutional staff must strictly implement disinfection, temperature measurement, and other preventive controls.
The institutions should emphasize mental adaptability of the elderly and staff to relieve anxiety and fear, pay close attention to the physical conditions of the elderly every day in time, measure the body temperature of the staff twice a day, regularly open windows for ventilation, regularly implement disinfection to maintain environmental hygiene within the institutions, and carry out knowledge education on epidemic prevention and control for staff and elderly residents in institutions.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all elderly care institutions to implement temporary closed management. During the temporary closed management period, they must cancel all elderly outings and family visits; the elderly who had taken leave and left could return to the hospital after inspection and evaluation after the epidemic ended; they should not take in new elderly. Except for personnel providing work security, medical security, logistical security, and prevention and control guidance, other unrelated personnel might not enter. Elderly residents might not leave without authorization. For elderly persons who really need to go out for medical reasons, the staff shall help them take protective measures.
The institutions should cancel gathering activities and dining. They should guide the elderly to stay in their own rooms as much as possible, or organize outdoor activities in batches. They should encourage relatives and children to use WeChat, video calls, and phone calls to express greetings to the elderly.
Other organizations with elderly care should conduct closed management as an elderly care institution.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 29, 2020, the Civil Affairs Department of Hubei ordered all home-based elderly care service organizations in the province to suspend home-visit service and temporary close all street day care centers for the elderly, home-based service centers for the elderly in urban and rural communities, meal stations for the elderly, and other service facilities. For the disabled (dementia) elderly at home, if there was a real need for home-visit nursing services, the visiting personnel shall conduct home services after the dispatched agency assessed their health and improved relevant protective measures, and shall clean and disinfect the elderly’s homes.

description: China, Guangdong province will enforce closed management to each residential area (using each residential development as the unit) starting on Feb 14, 2020. Limited access to all visitors' entry to the residential area except deliveries. All entry points will be guarded by a gateman 24 hours and each entry point will be equipped with at least one Infrared thermometer. In case of the absence of the gateman or detected body temperature exceeding 37.3 C, no entry will be allowed.

description:
Starting May 07, 2020, the Chinese national government released new guidelines for the reopening of primary and secondary schools: 

1) Document all returning staff and student and check temperature at school entrance. 
2) Must conduct 14 days of self-quarantine before returning 
3) Daily health monitoring during morning and nights. Must report data daily to local government 
4) Health monitoring/reporting of families of staff and students 
5) Surveillance of health risks on campus. Daily sterilization of public areas, hand-washing and drinking services, and trash collection.
6) Control population density on campus, maintain social distancing protocols. Different school start times, lunch times, and end times should vary to prevent mass gatherings.
7) Restriction on all mass gatherings such as conferences, meetings. 
8) Strengthen COVID-19 education for returning students and staff
9) Encourage collaboration and communication with parents. 
10) Open psychological counseling, mental health related services, hotlines. 
11) Encourage hand washing using sanitizers. 
12) Eye protection measures for long screen time 
13) Restriction to leave campus for campus residents. All dorm are restricted to 6 people max. Temperature check at dorm entrance.
14) All staff should wear appropriate PPE 
15) Encourage staff for voluntary COVID testing 
16) All non-local staff, students, and new students must not return to campus
17) All campus must organize a COVID-19 emergency task force.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

11) Encourage hand washing using sanitizers. 
12) Eye protection measures for long screen time 
13) Restriction to leave campus for campus residents. All dorm are restricted to 6 people max. Temperature check at dorm entrance.
14) All staff should wear appropriate PPE 
15) Encourage staff for voluntary COVID testing 
16) All non-local staff, students, and new students must not return to campus
17) All campus must organize a COVID-19 emergency task force.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Starting May 07, 2020, the Chinese national government released new guidelines for the reopening of primary and secondary schools: 

1) Document all returning staff and student and check temperature at school entrance. 
2) Must conduct 14 days of self-quarantine before returning 
3) Daily health monitoring during morning and nights. Must report data daily to local government 
4) Health monitoring/reporting of families of staff and students 
5) Surveillance of health risks on campus. Daily sterilization of public areas, hand-washing and drinking services, and trash collection.
6) Control population density on campus, maintain social distancing protocols. Different school start times, lunch times, and end times should vary to prevent mass gatherings.
7) Restriction on all mass gatherings such as conferences, meetings. 
8) Strengthen COVID-19 education for returning students and staff
9) Encourage collaboration and communication with parents. 
10) Open psychological counseling, mental health related services, hotlines. 
11) Encourage hand washing using sanitizers. 
12) Eye protection measures for long screen time 
13) Restriction to leave campus for campus residents. All dorm are restricted to 6 people max. Temperature check at dorm entrance.
14) All staff should wear appropriate PPE 
15) Encourage staff for voluntary COVID testing 
16) All non-local staff, students, and new students must not return to campus
17) All campus must organize a COVID-19 emergency task force.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jiangsu Province requires full-coverage nucleic acid testing for staff in elderly care institutions on Jun.19. People who have been to high epidemic risk areas are prohibited from accessing nursing homes. Elderly people who return to the nursing home or newly admitted must have nucleic acid testing or provide a nucleic acid test-related certification report before they are accessed to the institution. Visits will continue to strictly follow the principle of "no appointments no visits, visits after health assessments" to block the epidemic in elderly care institutions.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 22nd, 2021, Hebei, China published a guide for COVID-19 prevention and control at construction sites. The "Guide" requires that an epidemic prevention and control organization be established by the project leader at the construction site, equipped with adequate medical protective masks, protective clothing, goggles, disposable gloves, disinfectant alcohol, and disinfectant that meet national and industry standards. , Anti-epidemic materials such as intelligent body temperature detection equipment, and reliable supply channels. Real-name management is implemented for the entry personnel. The entry personnel must hold a health code and have a negative nucleic acid test before entering the construction site. After entering the construction site, the nucleic acid test should be performed in a timely manner according to the situation. All management personnel and migrant workers who enter the construction area, office area, and living area, including service personnel such as security guards, cleaning, canteens, etc., must wear masks, and the changed masks must be properly handled. Except for procurement personnel, material supply vehicles and personnel (the two categories of personnel should also check the health code and temperature measurement registration), all other personnel are not allowed to enter the site, and personnel at the entrance and exit shall be on duty 24 hours a day.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On January 28, the Henan Provincial Culture and Tourism Department announced specific guidelines for the tourism market on epidemics prevention and control during the Spring Festival of 2021. 
In principle, no large-scale events should be held during the Spring Festival period. Otherwise, it must be strictly approved based on careful evaluation. The number of audiences in theatres and other performance venues shall not exceed 75% of the theatre's seating capacity. For venues containing multiple theatre rooms, measures shall be implemented so the audiences can enter and exit through different routes and times to avoid large-scale gatherings. For all types of entertainment venues, the number of customers allowed for entrance shall not exceed 75% of the regular allowance. 
For travel agencies, safety risk assessments on tourism routes must be carefully conducted. It is strictly forbidden to organize travel to medium- and high-risk areas. Local administrative departments should urge travel agencies to implement the "one group, one report" system -- filling in travel information and uploading the electronic contracts on the national tourism supervision service platform for inspection. 
Star-rated should implement the epidemic prevention and control measures such as regular nucleic acid testing on imported cold-chain food and workers, disinfecting public supplies and appliances and widening the distance between tables.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)
